service.name: sarg
service.description: Squid Analysis Report Generator is a tool that allow you to view "where" your users are going to on the Internet.

field.description: Select proxy server to read logs from

Sarg report options. Default values are in ( )
If you select any option, it will be enabled on conf file.
Use CTRL + click on this field

option.name: Use anonymous file and directory names in the report. (no)
Convert ip address to dns name (no)
Use Ip Address instead userid in reports. (no)
Remove temporary files from root report directory (yes)
Generate the index tree by file (on)
Use comma instead point in reports (yes)

field.description:
Sarg report type. All are enabled by default
Use CTRL + click on this field

option.name: topusers - users, sites, times, bytes, connects, links to accessed sites, etc
topsites - site, connect and bytes report
users_sites - accessed sites by the user report
date_time - bytes used per day and hour report
denied - denied sites with full URL report
site_user_time_date - sites, dates, times and bytes report

field.description: Sort field for the User Report.

Users within the file will be excluded from reports.
You can use indexonly to have only index.html file.
Format: one user per line.

Reports will be generated only for listed users.
Format: user1:user2:...:usern

You can change the "userid" or the "ip address" to be a real user name on the reports.
If resolve_ip is active, the ip address is resolved before being looked up into this file.
That is, if you want to map the ip address, be sure to set resolv_ip to no or the resolved name will be looked into the file instead of the ip address.
Note that it can be used to resolve any ip address known to the dns and then map the unresolved ip addresses to a name found in the usertab file.
Table syntax: userid name or ip address name
Eg:
SirIsaac Isaac Newton
vinci Leonardo da Vinci
192.168.10.1 Karol Wojtyla

Records from access.log file that contain one of listed strings will be ignored.
Format: string1:string2:...:stringn

Hosts, domains or subnets will be excluded from reports.
Eg.: 192.168.10.10 - exclude ip address only
192.168.10.0/24 - exclude full C class
s1.acme.foo - exclude hostname only
*.acme.foo - exclude full domain name

Ignore records with these codes. Eg.: NONE/400
Write one code per line. Lines starting with a # are ignored.
Only codes matching exactly one of the line is rejected. The comparison is not case sensitive.
